loggers

Class CustomHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.logging.Handler
      • java.util.logging.StreamHandler
        • java.util.logging.FileHandler
          • loggers.CustomHandler

  • public class CustomHandler
extends java.util.logging.FileHandler
    Description: A custom logger handler used to enable logging to multiple files.
    Author:
    Geraint and Lucas

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CustomHandler(java.util.logging.Level level)
      Description: A custom handler for a given logger level.
      CustomHandler(java.lang.String s, boolean b, java.util.logging.Level level)
      Description: A custom handler for a given logger level and output file, with optional append
      CustomHandler(java.lang.String s, int i, int i1, boolean b, java.util.logging.Level level)
      Description: A custom handler to write to a set of files with optional append.
      CustomHandler(java.lang.String s, int i, int i1, java.util.logging.Level level)
      Description: A custom handler for a given logger level and output file.
      CustomHandler(java.lang.String s, java.util.logging.Level level)
      Description: A custom handler for a given logger level and output file.

        public CustomHandler(java.lang.String s,
                     boolean b,
                     java.util.logging.Level level)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     java.lang.SecurityException
        Description: A custom handler for a given logger level and output file, with optional append
        Parameters:
        s: - The name of the output file.
        b: - Optionally append to the output file.
        level: - A logger level.
        Throws:
        IOException: - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred
        SecurityException: - Thrown by the security manager to indicate a security violation.
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.SecurityException

      • CustomHandler

        public CustomHandler(java.lang.String s,
                     int i,
                     int i1,
                     java.util.logging.Level level)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     java.lang.SecurityException
        Description: A custom handler for a given logger level and output file. When (approximately) the given limit has been written to one file, another file will be opened. The output will cycle through a set of count files.
        Parameters:
        s: - The name of the output file.
        i: - The maximum number of bytes to write to any one file
        i1: - The number of files to use.
        level: - A logger level.
        Throws:
        IOException: - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
        SecurityException: - Thrown by the security manager to indicate a security violation.
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.SecurityException

      • CustomHandler

        public CustomHandler(java.lang.String s,
                     int i,
                     int i1,
                     boolean b,
                     java.util.logging.Level level)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     java.lang.SecurityException
        Description: A custom handler to write to a set of files with optional append. When (approximately) the given limit has been written to one file, another file will be opened. The output will cycle through a set of count files.
        Parameters:
        s: - The name of the output file
        i: - The maximum number of bytes to write to any one file.
        i1: - THe number of files to use
        b: - Optional append.
        level: - A logger level.
        Throws:
        IOException: - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
        SecurityException: - Thrown by the security manager to indicate a security violation.
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.SecurityException

        Parameters:
        logRecord: - description of the log event. A null record is silently ignored and is not published
